alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, central Pocahontas, southeastern Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Mill Creek to near Addison (Webster Springs). Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Dailey, Snowshoe, Mingo, Durbin, Huttonsville, Monterville, Cheat Bridge, Slaty Fork, Helvetia, Pickens, Waneta, Valley Head and Bergoo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
